page.title: 11TOWER BLOCK
page.content: The glass doors are jammed again, so I heave and pull, scraping them on the floor. The entrance is strewn with rubbish, and has an unidentifiable smell. At the lift I press the button-clanking and buzzing, but no sign of movement, so I head for the stairs. On the third flight of urine- stinking steps I have to wedge myself against the wall as two sweating, swearing men manhandle an un- cooperative matress over the rail. The next floor up the lift door is jammed open with a bag of golf clubs so that the people next door can fill it with furniture. They're moving today-lucky beggars! Behind my own front door it's comfortable, and quiet.
